verses.kjv: I cried unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice unto the LORD did I make my supplication.
verses.ct: I called out to the LORD with my voice; with my voice I pleaded with the LORD for help.

verses.kjv: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.
verses.ct: I poured out my frustration in his presence; I laid out all my troubles before him.

verses.kjv: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
verses.ct: When my spirit was completely crushed inside me, you already knew the road I was on. Along the path I was walking, my enemies had secretly set a trap for me.

verses.kjv: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
verses.ct: I looked to my right side, but no one was there to acknowledge me. Every escape route was gone; not a single person cared about my soul.

verses.kjv: I cried unto thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
verses.ct: I cried out to you, LORD. I said, "You are my safe place and everything I have in this life."

verses.kjv: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.
verses.ct: Pay attention to my desperate cry, because I have been brought so low. Rescue me from those who hunt me down, because they are more powerful than I am.

verses.kjv: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.
verses.ct: Free my soul from this prison so that I can give thanks to your name. The righteous will gather around me, because you will treat me with generosity.
